text: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: That's one small step for man, one giant leap for mankind.
author: Neil Armstrong

text: Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: I think, therefore I am.
author: René Descartes

text: The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Give me liberty, or give me death!
author: Patrick Henry

text: An eye for an eye only ends up making the whole world blind.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Well done is better than well said.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Happiness depends upon ourselves.
author: Aristotle

text: The weak can never forgive. Forgiveness is the attribute of the strong.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: I came, I saw, I conquered.
author: Julius Caesar

text: All that we are is the result of what we have thought.
author: Buddha

text: Knowledge is power.
author: Francis Bacon

text: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: Socrates

text: A house divided against itself cannot stand.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: History will be kind to me for I intend to write it.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Speak softly and carry a big stick.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
author: Walt Disney

text: It always seems impossible until it is done.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: Do what you feel in your heart to be right – for you’ll be criticized anyway.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
author: Aristotle

text: Opportunities multiply as they are seized.
author: Sun Tzu

text: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
author: William James

text: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
author: Confucius

text: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.
author: Buddha

text: It is not length of life, but depth of life.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: He who opens a school door, closes a prison.
author: Victor Hugo

text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Turn your wounds into wisdom.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: It is not enough to win a war; it is more important to organize the peace.
author: Aristotle

text: Do what you love and you will never work a day in your life.
author: Confucius

text: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Without music, life would be a mistake.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Life is a flower of which love is the honey.
author: Victor Hugo

text: Tact is the ability to describe others as they see themselves.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.
author: Sun Tzu

text: Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear – not absence of fear.
author: Mark Twain

text: The ballot is stronger than the bullet.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: If you want peace, work for justice.
author: Pope Paul VI

text: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.
author: Dalai Lama

text: If you would be loved, love and be lovable.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Nothing is impossible, the word itself says ‘I’m possible’!
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: Everything you can imagine is real.
author: Pablo Picasso

text: A leader is one who knows the way, goes the way, and shows the way.
author: John C. Maxwell

text: Learning never exhausts the mind.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: Believe you can and you’re halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: If you don’t like the road you’re walking, start paving another one.
author: Dolly Parton
